briefdescription.para: the enum used to represent RGB encoding
the enum used to represent BGR encoding
An enumerate with encoding types RGB and BGR.
An enumerate with encoding types RGB and BGR.

detaileddescription.para: Opens a KISS Graphics Window for drawing and input functions.

parameterdescription.para: The width of the graphics window
The height of the graphics window

detaileddescription.para: Closes the previously opened KISS Graphics Window
Update must be called after drawing to the window for changes to be visible. This function also must be called regularly for input to work.
Fills the entire window with the color black

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned char *data, Encoding enc, int x, int y, int width, int height)
memberdef.name: graphics_blit_enc

detaileddescription.para: Blits a pixel array onto the graphics context

parameterdescription.para: the 1D array of pixel data to blit
RGB for a Red-Green-Blue encoding or BGR for a Blue-Green-Red encoding
The destination x coordinate of the blit (target)
The destination y coordinate of the blit (target)
The width of the area to blit
The height of the area to blit

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned char *data, Encoding enc, int sx, int sy, int ex, int ey, int width, int height, int dx, int dy)
memberdef.name: graphics_blit_region_enc

detaileddescription.para: Blits a pixel array region onto the graphics context

parameterdescription.para: the 1D array of pixel data to blit
RGB for a Red-Green-Blue encoding or BGR for a Blue-Green-Red encoding
The start x coordinate of the blit (source)
The start y coordinate of the blit (source)
The end x coordinate of the blit (source)
The end y coordinate of the blit (source)
The width of the area to blit
The height of the area to blit
The destination x coordinate of the blit (target)
The destination y coordinate of the blit (target)

detaileddescription.para:
Fill the graphics context with a color.
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int y, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_pixel

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a pixel at (x, y)
x
the X coordinate of the pixel
y
the Y coordinate of the pixel
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_line

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a line from the point (x1, y1) to (x2, y2)
x1
the X coordinate of the first point
y1
the Y coordinate of the first point
x2
the X coordinate of the second point
y2
the Y coordinate of the second point
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int cx, int cy, int radius, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_circle

detaileddescription.para:
Draw an unfilled circle to the graphics window at the given coordinates and with the given radius.
cx
the X coordinate of the center of the circle
cy
the Y cordinate of the center of the circle
radius
the radius of the circle to be drawn
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int cx, int cy, int radius, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_circle_fill

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a filled circle to the graphics window at the given coordinates and with the given radius.
cx
the X coordinate of the center of the circle
cy
the Y cordinate of the center of the circle
radius
the radius of the circle to be drawn
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_rectangle

detaileddescription.para:
Draw an unfilled rectangle to the graphics window at the given coordinates.
x1
the X coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner
y1
the Y coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner
x2
the X coordinate of the rectangle's bottom-right corner
y2
the Y coordinate of the rectangle's bottom-right corner
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_rectangle_fill

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a filled rectangle to the graphics window at the given coordinates.
x1
the X coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner
y1
the Y coordinate of the rectangle's top-left corner
x2
the X coordinate of the rectangle's bottom-right corner
y2
the Y coordinate of the rectangle's bottom-right corner
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_triangle

detaileddescription.para:
Draw an unfilled triangle to the graphics window at the given coordinates. The order of the corners does not matter when drawing a triangle.
x1
the X coordinate of the triangle's first corner
y1
the Y coordinate of the triangle's first corner
x2
the X coordinate of the triangle's second corner
y2
the Y coordinate of the triangle's second corner
x3
the X coordinate of the triangle's third corner
y3
the Y coordinate of the triangle's third corner
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3, int r, int g, int b)
memberdef.name: graphics_triangle_fill

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a filled triangle to the graphics window at the given coordinates. The order of the corners does not matter when drawing a triangle.
x1
the X coordinate of the triangle's first corner
y1
the Y coordinate of the triangle's first corner
x2
the X coordinate of the triangle's second corner
y2
the Y coordinate of the triangle's second corner
x3
the X coordinate of the triangle's third corner
y3
the Y coordinate of the triangle's third corner
r
the red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
g
the green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
b
the blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
Gets the current state of a keyboard key.

simplesect.para: A KISS Graphics Window must be open for input functions to work.

parameterdescription.para: An ASCII key code or a Key value from the KeyCode enum.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the mouse's current position relative to the top left corner of the graphics window.

Returns the state of the mouse's middle button.
1 for pressed, 0 for not pressed

Returns the state of the mouse's left button.
1 for pressed, 0 for not pressed

Returns the state of the mouse's right button.
1 for pressed, 0 for not pressed

memberdef.argsstring: (int s[], int x, int y, int r, int g, int b, float size)
memberdef.name: graphics_segment_display

detaileddescription.para: Draw a 16 segment character (alphameric - caps only)

parameterdescription.para: The segments to display
The X coordinate of the first segment's top-left corner
The Y coordinate of the first segment's top-left corner
The red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The segment's size

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, int x, int y, int r, int g, int b, float size)
memberdef.name: graphics_print_character

detaileddescription.para: Prints out a character in 16 segment characters

parameterdescription.para: The character to display
The X coordinate of the character's top-left corner
The Y coordinate of the character's top-left corner
The red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The character's size

memberdef.argsstring: (char s[], int x, int y, int r, int g, int b, float size)
memberdef.name: graphics_print_string

detaileddescription.para: Prints out a text string in 16 segment characters

parameterdescription.para: The string to display
The X coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The Y coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The strings's size

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, int minNumDigits, int x, int y, int r, int g, int b, float size)
memberdef.name: graphics_print_int

detaileddescription.para: Prints out an integer in 16 segment characters

parameterdescription.para: The integer to display
minNumDigits is normally 0, but can be larger if leading 0's are desired
The X coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The Y coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The strings's size

memberdef.argsstring: (float n, int numDigits, int x, int y, int r, int g, int b, float size)
memberdef.name: graphics_print_float

detaileddescription.para: Prints out a float in 16 segment characters

parameterdescription.para: The float to display
numDigits is the number of digits to right of decimal to be printed
The X coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The Y coordinate of the first character's top-left corner
The red component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The green component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The blue component of the drawing, from 0 to 255
The strings's size
